questiontext.text:
Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (+ n 1)

       (* (mystery (/ n 2))

          (mystery (/ n 2)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (+ n 1)

       (+ (mystery (- n 1))

          (mystery (- n 1)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-1}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       1

       (+ (mystery (- n 1))

          (mystery (- n 1)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-1}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (or (= n 0) (= n 1))

       (+ n 1)

       (+ (mystery (- n 1))

          (mystery (- n 1)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-1}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=6} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (or (= n 0) (= n 1))

       1

       (+ (mystery (- n 1))

          (mystery (- n 1)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-1}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=6} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       1

       (+ (* 2 (mystery (- n 1)))

          (mystery (- n 1)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-1}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=5} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (* 2 (+ n 1))

       (+ (* 2 (mystery (- n 1)))

          3)))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-1}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (* 2 n)

       (+ (mystery (/ n 2))

          (* (mystery (/ n 2))

             3))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=5} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (* 2 n)

       (+ (mystery (/ n 3))

          (* (mystery (/ n 3))

             3))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/3}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=5} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (* 2 n)

       (+ (mystery (/ n 2))

          (* (mystery (/ n 2))

             (mystery (/ n 2))))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=3}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=6} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       n

       (+ (mystery (/ n 2))

          (* 2 (mystery (/ n 2))))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=5} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       n

       (+ (mystery (/ n 2)) n)))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       n

       (+ (mystery (/ n 2)) (* 2 n))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       1

       (* 3 (mystery (/ n 2)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       1

       (* 3 (mystery (- n 2)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       n

       (+ (* 3 n)

          (mystery (- n 2)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n-2}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (+ n 1)

       (let ((m (/ n 3)))

         (+ (mystery m)

            (mystery m)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/3}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       (+ n 1)

       (let ((m (/ n 3)))

         (let ((v (mystery m)))

           (+ v v)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/3}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=3} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       2

       (let ((m (/ (- n 1) 3)))

         (let ((v (mystery m)))

           (+ v v)))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=(n-1)/3}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       2

       (let ((m (/ n 3)))

         (let ((v (mystery m)))

           (+ v (/ v 3))))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/3}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=4} otherwise

Analyse the following function to determine the appropriate recurrence relation defining its time complexity, T(n). (You may regard any undeclared operators as basic operations). 
 

 (define (mystery n)

   (if (<= n 1)

       2

       (let ((m (/ n 3)))

         (let ((v (mystery m)))

           (+ (mystery (/ n 3))

 	     (+ v (/ v 3)))))))

Fill in the missing expressions below. If your answer is an expression involving more than one character, do not insert any spaces. e.g. "n/2" not "n / 2" or "n-2" not "n - 2". (Your answer will be marked wrong if you do include the space).

T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=1} if n <= 1
T(n) = {1:SHORTANSWER:=2}T({1:SHORTANSWER:=n/3}) + {1:SHORTANSWER:=6} otherwise
